text: {{Infobox writer |image =Antón Riveiro Coello, Álvaro Mutis e Alberto Piñeiro..jpg |imagesize = 250px | | name = Álvaro Mutis | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = Bogotá, Colombia | death_date = | death_place = Mexico City, Mexico | occupation = Poet and novelist | notableworks = The Adventures and Misadventures of Maqroll | genre = Fiction | networth = | website = }} Álvaro Mutis Jaramillo (August 25, 1923 - September 22, 2013) was a Colombian poet, novelist, and essayist. His best-known work is the novel sequence The Adventures and Misadventures of Maqroll. He was awarded the 2001 Miguel de Cervantes Prize and the 2002 Neustadt International Prize for Literature. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2013 deaths Category:South American poets Category:Essayists Category:Writers from Bogotá Category:Miguel de Cervantes Prize winners
title: Álvaro Mutis
